occupation: Organization Development / Organization Design Strategy Lead at Starbucks
headline: Organization Development Consultant | Coach | "What Do You Know To Be True?" Podcast Host
summary:
I believe I am unlocking my potential when I’m working with others to unlock their potential.

I work with leaders and teams to achieve transformational results by taking on their most challenging business problems and unlocking higher performance. My purpose is to be in service to those who want to dig deep to unlock their challenges, achieve their potential, and find meaning in their work.

With 25+ years of experience, I am known for leading teams to deliver innovative solutions by using a research-based approach that combines systems thinking, human-centered design, and co-creation for developing higher-performing teams and individuals. I have designed and delivered solutions in the areas of Organization Development, Strategy Activation, Organization Design, Leader and Team Effectiveness, Change Management, and Culture Transformation.

I enjoy engaging in the intersections of productivity and performance, leadership and team effectiveness, inclusion and belonging, and neuroscience, and then working with smart people to co-design and implement new and innovative solutions to achieve business and people goals.

I’ve managed teams of direct reports in addition to managing engagement teams. I’ve developed and delivered adult learning experiences on topics of leadership, change management, fundamental consulting skills, and project and program management. I’ve written content for company blogs and thought leadership articles, created and host a podcast called "What Do You Know To Be True?" and authored a book entitled "The Project Success Checklist: Drive Alignment, Produce Results, and Reduce the Risk of Project Failure."

experiences.title: Organization Development / Organization Design Strategy Lead
experiences.description:
Partnering with leaders and teams to help reimagine new ways of working to achieve our aggressive strategic goals.

• Lead Org Design efforts to design new Operating Models and Organizational Systems that amplify our ability to achieve strategic goals, accelerates our culture, and create a place where partners (employees) can thrive.

• Design and develop the Organization Design Approach and Toolkit to inform future design efforts. Roll out to users in PRO (HR).

experiences.company: What Do You Know To Be True?
experiences.title: Podcast Host & Producer
experiences.description:
"What Do You Know To Be True?" is a series of conversations with ordinary people about their extraordinary talent, their superhero power, that when used well it creates meaningful impact with others. 

The goal of the conversations is not to try to emulate it or “hack” our way to a new talent. Instead, I’m curious to learn what inspired them to develop this extraordinary talent, how they think about their superhero power, and the impact it has on others as well as themselves. The intention is to learn more about their experiences with their superhero power, and in doing so a maybe learn something about the special talent in each of us that makes us unique.

Episodes come out every two weeks, available on all platforms including Apple, Spotify, YouTube, and www.WhatDoYouKnowToBeTrue.com.

experiences.title: Board Member
experiences.description:
GV is a deliberately diverse, youth-led organization that provides high school youth in Guatemala and the United States the experiences and capabilities to become more empathetic and inclusive leaders who create positive changes aimed at create more just and sustainable communities.

During my six year term, I partnered with senior leadership and board officers to help guide the organization through the difficult financial times as a result of a volcanic eruption, leadership transitions, and the pandemic. I am proud that GV came out of the pandemic not only surviving, but thriving stronger than pre-pandemic performance levels and staff engagement

As a Board Director:
• I partnered with leadership to co-create solutions to financial challenges that threated the ability of the organization to stay open during the pandemic.
• I partnered with another Board director and staff member to established the Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB) program for the Board.
• Wrote strategic communications for the board and organization.
• I've served as a Board Officer in the role as Chair for 3 years and Vice Chair for 1 year.

experiences.title: Senior Manager | Organization Transformation | People Advisory Services
experiences.description:
Proposed and led organization transformation engagements and created high performing teams as an organization transformation leader for EY’s People Advisory Services. Focused efforts on operating model / organization design, strategy activation, leadership effectiveness, and change management for clients across multiple industries. Accomplishments include:

• Sold and led a strategy activation assessment for a $17B, 25K-person media and entertainment business. Engaged senior leadership team to align on their 5- and 10-year strategic plan, assessed current capabilities aligned to plan, and presented recommendations for investments in their strategic capabilities, operating model, and workforce model.

• Sold and led the development of a 3-year strategy roadmap, re-design of the operating model and organization structure, and change management for a mobility function within a Fortune 100 client. Co-presented the project work with client at the 2023 EY Mobility Reimagined global conference.

• Led an employee experience improvement program within a Human Resources function of a 160K-person company, aimed to address common complaints across a multiple-vendor ecosystem. Work was recognized by winning the company’s 2021 Supplier Prestige Award for Supplier-to-Supplier Collaboration.

• Partnered on the design and implementation of internal Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging programs within the firm, including campus recruiting and allyship.

experiences.title: Solution Lead - Organizational Transformation & Change Management
experiences.description:
(EY acquired PeopleFirm in December 2019)

Partnered with leadership teams at client companies to define organizational goals and co-design solutions for strategy activation, org design, leadership and team effectiveness, and change management engagements. Grew business by managing accounts and developing client solutions.

Key highlights include:

• Proposed and led the operating model and organization design and implementation for a 2K-person IT organization within a $95B consumer technology company. Developed leadership narratives, built manager-employee engagement programs, and conducted role placement in an immersive experience.

• Designed and led team effectiveness program for 12-person leadership team in Fortune 500 Internet company, including workshops, peer-learning groups, team agreements on behaviors, and health metrics.

• Designed and delivered change management approach and toolkit for 100+ HR Business Partners to perform or provide oversight for OCM activities for a global technology company.

• Drove the change management strategy for a 150K-person, $74B financial services company to reduced corporate office space by 9M square feet in United States using innovative change solutions.

experiences.title: Lead Instructor | Leadership and High Performing Teams
experiences.description: I redesigned the Leadership & Communications in Project Management course, trained other instructors, and delivered the course to students. I also enjoyed writing and presenting Leadership and Agile content for the program’s online courses.

experiences.title: Practice Leader | Organizational Effectiveness
experiences.description:
I collaborated with two other leaders to establish the Org Effectiveness practice in Seattle, which resulted in creating $6M in revenue in year one, growing to $12M by year three. I focused on selling and delivering client projects, developing the Change Management solutions, and upskilling our practitioners. Highlights include:

• Delivered customer-centric Org Design projects, including the redesign of a 900-person IT organization by engaging the leaders of 9 functional areas, resulting in unanimous agreement amongst leadership team.

• Led and delivered efforts to build solution methodologies and toolkits for Change Management, Leadership Development, and Org Design practices, used for client delivery and practitioner training.

• Delivered Team Effectiveness and Leader Development program for technology leadership team within $9B financial services company. Included facilitated workshops, peer-learning groups, and health metrics.

• Developed new sales strategy based on thought leadership. Wrote weekly blog published on company website and developed white papers, generating$2M in net new revenue in first year of program.

experiences.title: Consulting Manager & Solution Lead
experiences.description:
Led and delivered organization design, change management, and leadership effectiveness engagements in the technology, insurance, healthcare, financial, and retail sectors, and managed a team of 10 consultants. Highlights include:

• Led the change management and training workstreams for the development of a business intelligence reporting application using the Agile methodology that enabled a $19B insurance company to reduce a Key Performance Indicators reporting process across 5 businesses from 21 to3 days.

• Designed and led a leadership effectiveness program with 12-person team focused on trust, accountability, collaboration, and feedback, resulting in increased engagement scores by 40% in 6 months.

• Solution Lead for the Project Management Center of Excellence, participated in sales, developed toolkits, and facilitated learning experiences for consultants and clients. 

• Authored and published "The Project Success Checklist: Drive Alignment, Product Results, and Reduce the Risk of Project Failure," which showcases the process I developed to identify and integrate critical success factors into scope, schedule, risk, and measurement plans. Published in 2015. Developed and delivered training courses and wrote blogs on Project Management.

experiences.title: Principal Technical Project Manager
experiences.description:
I had the pleasure of working on world-class, customer-facing projects for mobile, music, pictures, and small business products, solving for internal systemic issues and challenges, and developing a strong team of project leaders.

• Designed and led new annual budget and capacity planning process for the 1,500-person, $300M AOL Products org, identified $500K-savingsfrom FY03process. The FY04 plan received CEO approval early and I was recognized with "Above and Beyond" award. Asked back in FY05 to perform the process again.

• Provided critical analysis to creatively solve organizational inefficiencies, including turning Mobile technical support from $300Kcost center to $1M revenue stream for AOL Mobile Services.
experiences.location: Mountain View, CA and Seattle, WA
